Software will *never* be “secure.” N-E-V-E-R. The best you can achieve is to instrument its environs, such that someone who cares sees evidence of suspicious or malicious activity in time to stop escalation to breach. This has been true for decades; “prevention eventually fails.”

@florenciocano That’s why I promote #networksecuritymonitoring, not intrusion detection (although IDS is part). That’s why @4n6ir @DavidJBianco and others invented commercial threat hunting. Immaculate detection is a myth, because it could be used for prevention. But we know that is impossible.

What does "holding territory" mean in cyberspace?
Considerations include: 
1) physical control of the hardware
2) control of the platform, identities, update mechanisms, or other aspects of the environment
3) access to assets on the platform
All of this and more can be contested.
